10.Message:: firefoxtree: remove unused import and legacy compatibility code r=gps  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4180

11.Message:: firefoxtrees: fix templating issues under Mercurial 4.7 (Bug 1485553) r=gps  Mercurial 4.7 made several changes at the template layer, including wrapping most displayable objects to enable usage with legacy templates. This commit wraps the output of `template_fxheads` when running under Mercurial 4.7.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4179

12.Message:: unifyrepo: make changeset hashes deterministic in test  Made an error in my initial implementation where I overwrite $HGRCPATH instead of appending. This commit fixes that issue.

13.Message:: unifyrepo: set `testedwith` to 4.6, acquire wlock before bookmark write  Now that we have tests for this extension, we can set the `testedwith` string as we do with other extensions. Since we only need the extension to work under 4.6 at the moment, this commit also gets rid of some compatibility conditionals.  After adding this change, the tests give a devel-warn about requiring a `wlock()` as well as a `lock()` to write bookmarks. This commit also adds that to the extension.

14.Message:: unifyrepo: re-enable OnFailure emails (Bug 1480203)  In writing tests for unifyrepo for bug 1484231, I came across an issue with how a variable is assigned during consecutive loops. This may have fixed bug 1480203 in the process. Turning emails back on while I deploy that change so we can verify.

15.Message:: unifyrepo: add test for daemon process (Bug 1484231) r=gps  This commit adds a test for the unify-daemon process. The main thing to test in this instance is that we can successfully use the script to specify an `hg` executable and config files.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D3938

16.Message:: unifyrepo: add basic test functionality (Bug 1484231) r=gps  This commit adds a basic test for unifyrepo functionality. The test covers all available config options and a few failure conditions (no common ancestor, pushlog required).  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D3937

17.Message:: unifyrepo: verify pushlog is available before repo unification (Bug 1484231) r=gps  This extension requires a pushlog to exist on every source repo to correctly function. While we are ensuring the repos have correct origin commits, we should also check for a pushlog.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D3936

18.Message:: unifyrepo: set `path` variable correctly while iterating over source repos (Bug 1484231) r=gps  The path variable is set when iterating over the source repos the first time, but it is never reset to the correct source when iterating over the sources a second time. Therefore whatever repo was last in the iteration during the first loop will have the same name in the final loop.  This causes an issue in the `unifypushes` function, as we will hit the `if lastsource == source and lastid == pushid` condition when pushlogs between two separate repos have the same push id. For example, this condition will be true for repo1 push 1 and repo2 push 1, as source is the same for all repos. This is likely the root cause of bug 1480203, further testing will be required to know for certain.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D3935

19.Message:: unifyrepo: move `hg replicatesync` call behind conditional flag (Bug 1484231) r=gps  Without this flag, `unifyrepo` is dependent on vcsreplicator to be tested. This means we require the hgmodocker environment to run tests on unifyrepo, and we currently don't have those features available in CI. With this flag we can turn off the replication call and test the extension without Docker.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D3934

6.Message:: Bug 1485738: Add column number information to the JitSpew r=mgaudet  Summary: It is currently quite difficult to debug minified scripts.  The JitSpew and profiler used to display only line numbers, so all of the output would be emitted as "script:1".  Column number information is now collected by the gecko profiler as of bug 785922.  The JitSpew should also emit column numbers so that it's easy to line up with the profiler output.  Reviewers: mgaudet  Reviewed By: mgaudet  Subscribers: jandem  Bug #: 1485738  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4677

11.Message:: Bug 1471583. Add a new ImgDrawResult variant to distinguish INCOMPLETE and 'fully drew an image which wasn't really complete'. r=tnikkel

12.Message:: Bug 1471583. Don't record a successful image draw if the image isn't marked complete. r=mattwoodrow  The image can be decoded but we haven't notified such (and hence the image state doesn't indicate such). We are able to draw the image at this point because painting has special access to the image that bypasses the image state (this happens via nsStyleImage::StartDecoding -> imgIRequest::StartDecodingWithResult).  In this state if we record a successful draw then any parts of the image that we newly drew but weren't invalidated for some other reason won't get updated. When the async decode notification gets processed it will invalidate the image and that will result in it getting updated. But if we get a paint that asks for sync decoding of images before this it will see that we sucessfully drew the image and not invalidate its area and the sync decode paint won't update the image.  So we still draw the image but we don't record a successful draw unless the image state is complete and hence the decode notification has been processed (image state and notifications are always in sync).  Note that we still have to draw the image in this state because if we get a normal paint after a sync decode paint we have to draw the image because if we don't we effectively erase the image.

13.Message:: Bug 1478269 - Fix the outputs and clobbers of inline assembly blocks in yuv_row_posix.cpp. r=jrmuizel  While the current code compiles fine with the file as it is, with LTO enabled, some functions end up inlined into their callers and their callers, recursively, and the compiler doesn't know some of the registers have been modified by the assembly, leading to bad decisions, and bad behavior at runtime. The same problem would likely happen if we were using UNIFIED_SOURCES in the directory.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4200

14.Message:: Bug 1478269 - Use symbolic names as input operands. r=jrmuizel  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4199

15.Message:: Bug 1478269 - Remove ycbcr update script and patches. r=jrmuizel  ycbcr is dead upstream, and has been for almost as long as the code in the gecko tree hasn't been updated. Let's not pretend that we can actually run the update script and that having the patches separated matters, because there's no upstream to apply those patches to anymore.  Update README accordingly.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4198

16.Message:: Bug 1486654 - Enable static analysis on all Linux CI builds. r=ted  And turn off separate static analysis build tasks.

17.Message:: Bug 1486652 - Make x86 linux builds actual cross builds. r=ted  The x86 linux builds originally were performed in x86 build environment. That was a long time ago. Since then, they moved to x86-64 hosts with x86 headers and libraries. But for reasons that might have to do with the build system not really supporting cross-compilation nicely back then, the build is still explicitly passing both --host and --target, making those builds non-cross builds.  Since the toolchains used to build are for x86-64, the fact that --host is for x86 actually prevents enabling the clang plugin, so we need to turn these builds in actual cross builds if we want to enable the clang plugin.

18.Message:: Bug 1486938: Remove login-manager-storage category entry. r=MattN  This is an unused feature, with a strange implementation. If we need such an override in the future, it can be accomplished by just overriding a contract ID.  This patch also changes the implementation to simply define a contract ID for the appropriate default implementation at registration time rather than adding a duplicate platform check at runtime.

1.Message:: Bug 1483043 - Only call SerializeURI if running in e10s. r=mak a=jorgk DONTBUILD  Some nsIURI types do not implement nsIIPCSerializableURI, and this is causing a crash in SerializeURI when running in thunderbird. This shouldn't happen, since thunderbird is not running under e10s, so even attempting to serialize the URIs is pointless.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D3402

7.Message:: Bug 1441059 - Make nsILoadURIDelegate async to preserve the order of GeckoSession.loadUri() calls. r=snorp,bz a=ritu  This alters nsILoadURIDelegate.loadURI() to return a Promise rather than spinning the event loop to synchronously return a boolean, and alters nsDocShell::InternalLoad to allow for those changes by re-calling itself if necessary based on the resolution of the promise.

11.Message:: Bug 1486200 - Apply Photon theme for Date/Time pickers only on API >=23. r=jchen, a=RyanVM  Fix Lollipop crashes because of android.content.res.ColorStateList.addFirstIfMissing() The default app theme will be applied for the material Date/Time pickers on API 21 and API 22. After this, on API >=23 they will be Photon themed.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4464

18.Message:: Bug 1486571 - 8. Add tests for Oreo auto-fill frontend; r=snorp, a=RyanVM  Add some tests for the Oreo auto-fill frontend, similar to the tests for the a11y auto-fill frontend. However, because these tests depend on the ViewStructure class, they require SDK 23+ to run.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D3810

19.Message:: Bug 1486571 - 7. Add Oreo auto-fill frontend; r=esawin, r=snorp, a=RyanVM  Add a frontend for the Oreo auto-fill API in SessionTextInput, which processes events from Gecko and provides consumer APIs that match the Oreo auto-fill APIs. GeckoView then forwards the necessary calls to SessionTextInput.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D3538
